intro: Lespedeza swinhoei, commonly known as the Chinese lespedeza, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, three-lobed leaves and has a sprawling growth habit, often forming dense mats. Lespedeza swinhoei is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in erosion-prone areas.
